metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10928 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_symlink_req in glusterfs server which allows symlink destinations to point to file paths outside of the gluster volume. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to create arbitrary symlinks pointing anywhere on the server and execute arbitrary code on glusterfs server nodes. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled RPC requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to write iles to an arbitrary location and execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-cli - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterd0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
